review_blob: So oily, so much coconut. The rum shows as a spicy edge, the apple brandy as a delicate apple cider esquire tartness. So refreshing, yet so heavy in soy and yeast notes. Amazing!
beer_name: Cigar City Hunahpus Imperial Stout - Double Barrel Aged

review_blob: Fruity mint and zest on the nose. Oily palate, really slicks and sticks around. Bitter pith and lactic acid up front, some lighter perfumey fruit notes, a dry, vineous and mildly nutty finish

Tropical fruit, apricot, caramel nose. Mild carb, oily palate. Upfront bitterness and sweet caramel, citrus notes, tropical fruit, very slight building warmth from chilli and herbal note from the mint in the finish. A great beer, but rather than focusing and drowning out the base beer with adjuncts, it uses them to enhance.

I respect it for this but still found it slightly underwhelming.

Much more murky than other spontan- series beers Ive had, smells tart and zesty on the nose, with a hint of barnyard. Tart and puckering sourness with prominent fruit sourness and funky as hell. So so freshing, crisp and dry, so easily smashable on a hot day

Very spritzy, tart nose with a touch of acetic acid, citrus. Palate crisp with a sour snap. Tart with a good hit of lactic acid, a touch of red berry sweetness and a dry finish. Very refreshing, crazy drinkable.

Nose: cognac, sweet toffee, cognac, wee bit of roast, cognac
Pour: very dark brown, no head, mocha lacing
Mouthfeel: very light carbonation, full bodied
Palate: Jesus, this is outstandingly more-ish! First up, cognac sweetness followed by a lovely chocolate and oat mix finished with slight booziness in the throat. On further mouthfuls roastiness makes itself apparent.

Overall, a dark beer as smooth as its cognac counterpart, being tasty with low carbonation means this goes down ridiculously well for 10.9%
beer_name: Mikkeller Beer Geek Brunch Weasel (Cognac Edition)

review_blob:
Pour: black, no head, cream lacing
Mouthfeel: oily, medium body
Nose: caramel, oak, malt, booze, whiskey
Palate: heavy chocolate, oak, vanilla, a little peat, some coffee roast, booze warmth on the throat

Amazing
beer_name: De Molen Hel & Verdoemenis Misto BA
